```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE,warning = FALSE,message = FALSE)
library(RSQLite)
library(ggplot2)
library(scales)
library(plotly)
library(esquisse)
theme_set(theme_linedraw())
```

```{r,echo=FALSE}
rm(list=ls())
source("../DATA/movavg.R")
db <- db <- dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(),dbname= "../COVIDDB/COVID.sqlite3")
df <- dbGetQuery(db,"select * from JHUDATA")
df$date <- as.Date(df$date)
df <- df[order(df$date,decreasing = TRUE),]
df <- subset(df,country =="US")
str(df)

```

### GGPLOt2 Plots of Cumulative Cases and Deaths
#### Source: New York Times

```{r,echo=FALSE}
cumm_cases <-ggplot(df) +geom_line(aes(x=date,y=confirmed),lwd=3,col="red") + 
    scale_x_date(date_breaks = "1 month") +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +
   theme(axis.text.x=element_text(angle =- 45, vjust = 0.5)) +
  labs(title="US Cumulative Total Cases",
       x="Date Reported",y="Cumulative Cases") 
```
```{r}
cumm_deaths <-ggplot(df) +geom_line(aes(x=date,y=deaths),lwd=3,col="blue") + 
    scale_x_date(date_breaks = "1 month") +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +
   theme(axis.text.x=element_text(angle =- 45, vjust = 0.5)) +
  labs(title="US Cumulative Total Deaths",x="Date Reported",y="Cumulative Deaths")
ggplotly(cumm_cases)
ggplotly(cumm_deaths)
```

## GGPLOt2 Plots of Daily Deaths and Deaths
#### Source: European CDPC

```{r, echo=FALSE}
df1 <- dbGetQuery(db,"select * from ECDC")
df1$Reported <- as.Date(df1$Reported)
df1 <- df1[order(df1$Reported,decreasing = TRUE),]
df1 <- subset(df1,Countries =="USA" )
df1$Reported <- as.Date(df1$Reported)
mean(df1$Deaths)
df1death <- df1 %>% filter(Reported>="2020-02-29") 
```
#### Average US Covid-19 Deaths/day

```{r}
mean(df1death$Death)
```

```{r,echo=FALSE}

p1 <-ggplot(df1) +geom_line(aes(x=Reported,y=Cases,col="red"),lwd=2,col="red") + 
    scale_x_date(date_breaks = "1 month") +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +
   theme(axis.text.x=element_text(angle =- 45, vjust = 0.5)) +
  labs(title="US Daily Total Cases(2020-03-01 - 2020-09-08)",x="Date Reported",y="Daily Cases")
ggplotly(p1)
```

```{r,echo=FALSE}
p2 <-ggplot(df1death) +geom_line(aes(x=Reported,y=Deaths),lwd=2,col="blue") + 
    scale_x_date(date_breaks = "1 month") +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +
   theme(axis.text.x=element_text(angle =- 45, vjust = 0.5)) +
  labs(title="US Daily Total Deaths(2020-03-01 - 2020-09-08)",x="Date Reported",y="Daily Deaths") +
  geom_hline(yintercept=977,col="red",lwd=2) +
  geom_hline(yintercept=1873,col="green",lwd=2) +
  geom_hline(yintercept=1493,col="black",lwd=2)
ggplotly(p2)
```

#### Histograms of Daily Cases and Deaths

```{r, echo=FALSE}
ggplot(df1) + geom_histogram(aes(x=Deaths))   +
  labs(title="Histogram of Daily Deaths")

ggplot(df1) + geom_histogram(aes(x=Cases))   +
  labs(title="Histogram of Daily Cases")
  
```
```{r}
ggplot(df1) + geom_bar(aes(x=Deaths,fill=..count..),stat="bin")
ggplot(df1) + geom_bar(aes(x=Cases,fill=..count..),stat="bin")
```
